results.name: Triangle of even numbered entries of odd numbered rows of Pascal's triangle A007318.
comment: The row polynomials Pe(n, x) := Sum_{m=0..n} a(n, m)*x^m appear as numerators of the generating functions for the even numbered column sequences of array A034870.
Elements have the same parity as those of Pascal's triangle.

All zeros of polynomial Pe(n, x) are negative. They are -tan^2(Pi/2*n+1), -tan^2(2*Pi/2*n+1), ..., -tan^2(n*Pi/2*n+1). Moreover, for m >= 1, Pe(m, -x^2) is the characteristic polynomial of the linear difference equation with constant coefficients for differences between multiples of 2*m+1 with even and odd digit sum in base 2*m in the interval [0,(2*m)^n). - _Vladimir Shevelev_ and _Peter J. C. Moses_, May 22 2012
Row reverse of A103327. - _Peter Bala_, Jul 29 2013

The row polynomial Pe(d, x), multiplied by (2*d)!/d! = A001813(d), gives the numerator polynomial of the o.g.f. of the sequence of the diagonal d, for d >= 0, of the Sheffer triangle Lah[4,1] given in A048854. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 12 2017
reference: A. M. Yaglom and I. M. Yaglom, An elementary proof of the Wallis, Leibniz and Euler formulas for pi. Uspekhi Matem. Nauk, VIII (1953), 181-187(in Russian).

formula: T(n, m) = binomial(2*n+1, 2*m) = A007318(2*n+1, 2*m), n >= m >= 0, otherwise 0.
O.g.f. for n-th diagonal: ( Sum_{k = 0..n} binomial(2*n,2*k)*x^k )/(1 - x)^(2*n).
